member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStoreAccess
member.summary: Represents the levels of access a object may provide.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStoreAccess.None
member.summary: Access to none of the APIs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStoreAccess.Minimal
member.summary: Access only to the GetApplications and other read-only publicly needed APIs.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStoreAccess.Credentials
member.summary: Access to the GetCredentials, GetCredentialsUsingTicket, DeleteCredentials, and IssueTicket API in addition to all the privileges granted by .

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStoreAccess.RestrictedCredentials
member.summary: Access to the GetRestrictedCredentials API in addition to all the privileges granted by .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission
member.summary: Represents a custom permission that controls the ability to access Secure Store Service object model resources. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.#ctor(System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The permission state that specifies whether this permission has full access or no access to Secure Store Service resources.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.Access
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of access that this permission object has.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that specifies the level of access that this permission object has.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.Copy
member.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission object.
member.returns: A copy of the current permission object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.FromXml(System.Security.SecurityElement)
member.summary: Reconstructs a SecureStorePermission object from an XML encoding.
member.param: The XML encoding from which to reconstruct the SecureStorePermission object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.Intersect(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Returns the logical intersection of two SecureStorePermission instances.
member.returns: A new SecureStorePermission instance that represents the intersection of the current instance and the target parameter. If the intersection is empty, the method returns null.
member.param: The SecureStorePermission instance to intersect with the current instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.IsSubsetOf(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current permission is a subset of the specified permission.
member.returns: true if the current permission is a subset of the specified permission; otherwise, false.
member.param: A permission to test for the subset relationship. This permission must be the same type as the current permission.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.IsUnrestricted
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance of the permission has unrestricted access to the resources protected by the permission.
member.returns: true if the current permission is unrestricted; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.ToXml
member.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the permission object and its current state.
member.returns: An XML encoding of the permission object, including any state information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.Union(System.Security.IPermission)
member.summary: Creates a permission that is the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
member.returns: A new permission that represents the union of the current permission and the specified permission.
member.param: A permission to combine with the current permission. It must be of the same type as the current permission.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermission.Version
member.summary: Specifies the version of the class.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermissionAttribute
member.summary: Allows security actions for a instance to be applied to code using declarative security. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermissionAttribute.#ctor(System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The security action to be performed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermissionAttribute.Access
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of access that this object has.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that specifies the level of access that this object has.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermissionAttribute.CreatePermission
member.summary: Creates and returns a new SecureStorePermission object.
member.returns: A SecureStorePermission object that corresponds to this attribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Office.SecureStoreService.Server.Security.SecureStorePermissionAttribute.Unrestricted
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether full permission to the resource protected by the attribute is declared.
member.returns: true if this SecureStorePermissionAttribute object has permission; otherwise, false.
